org.coode.xml

Interface XMLWriter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    XMLWriterImpl

    public interface XMLWriter
    Developed as part of the CO-ODE project http://www.co-ode.org
    Author:
    Matthew Horridge, The Univeristy Of Manchester, Medical Informatics Group, Date: May 30, 2006

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods

    • Method Detail

      • setEncoding

        void setEncoding(String encoding)
        Sets the encoding for the document that the rdfwriter produces. The default encoding is "UTF-8".
        Parameters:
        encoding - The encoding.

      • getNamespacePrefixes

        XMLWriterNamespaceManager getNamespacePrefixes()
        Gets the Writer's namespace manager.
        Returns:
        The namespace manager.

      • getXMLBase

        String getXMLBase()
        Returns:
        xml base

      • setWrapAttributes

        void setWrapAttributes(boolean b)
        Causes the current element's attributes to be wrapped in the output.
        Parameters:
        b - If true then the attributes will be wrapped if they are long. If false then no attribute wrapping will occur.

      • startDocument

        @Deprecated
void startDocument(String rootElementName)
                         throws IOException
        Deprecated. use start
        Starts writing the document. The root element will contain the namespace declarations and xml:base attribute. If the name of the element is an IRI, use startDocument(IRI)
        Parameters:
        rootElementName - The name of the root element.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was an IO problem

      • startDocument

        void startDocument(IRI rootElement)
            throws IOException
        Starts writing the document. The root element will contain the namespace declarations and xml:base attribute.
        Parameters:
        rootElement - The iri of the root element.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was an IO problem

      • endDocument

        void endDocument()
          throws IOException
        Causes all open elements, including the document root element, to be closed.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was an IO problem

      • writeStartElement

        void writeStartElement(String name)
                throws IOException,
                       IllegalElementNameException
        Writes the start of an element.
        Parameters:
        name - The tag name of the element to be written. This must be a valid QName. If name is an IRI use writeStartName(IRI)
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was an IO problem
        IllegalElementNameException - if the specified name is not a valid QName

      • writeStartElement

        void writeStartElement(IRI name)
                throws IOException,
                       IllegalElementNameException
        Writes the start of an element.
        Parameters:
        name - The tag name of the element to be written. This must be a valid QName.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was an IO problem
        IllegalElementNameException - if the specified name is not a valid QName

      • writeEndElement

        void writeEndElement()
              throws IOException
        Writes the closing tag of the last element to be started.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was an IO problem

      • writeAttribute

        void writeAttribute(String attr,
                    String val)
             throws IOException
        Writes an attribute of the last element to be started (that has not been closed). Note: if the attribute is an iri, use writeAttribute(IRI, String
        Parameters:
        attr - The name of the attribute
        val - The value of the attribute
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was an IO problem

      • writeAttribute

        void writeAttribute(IRI attr,
                    String val)
             throws IOException
        Writes an attribute of the last element to be started (that has not been closed).
        Parameters:
        attr - The name of the attribute
        val - The value of the attribute
        Throws:
        IOException - if there was an IO problem

               throws IOException
        Writes a text element
        Parameters:
